stories.title: Optimize test suite with shared database container
stories.description: Tests are slow because each it.layer() block creates a new PostgreSQL container. Effect layers are memoized by identity - each new layer object gets its own container. Layer.fresh() in AuthService.test.ts is unnecessary since factory functions already return new objects.
acceptance_criteria: Single PostgreSQL container shared across ALL test files via vitest globalSetup
Container starts once before all tests, stops once after all tests complete
Remove unnecessary Layer.fresh() from createTestLayer() - factory functions already return new objects
SharedPgClientLive layer that uses inject('dbUrl') from globalSetup
All test files use SharedPgClientLive instead of PgContainer.ClientLive
Migrations still run per it.layer() block (idempotent, fast after first run)
Test suite time reduced by eliminating per-block container startup

technical_details.layer_semantics_key_insight: Layers are memoized by object identity (reference equality), not by type. Factory functions return NEW objects each time - no memoization occurs between calls. Layer.fresh() is only needed when the SAME layer reference appears twice in a composition and you want separate instances.
implementation_steps: 1. Create vitest.global-setup.ts that starts PostgreSqlContainer and provides dbUrl via provide()
3. Create SharedPgClientLive in packages/persistence/test/Utils.ts using inject('dbUrl')
4. Update RepositoriesLayer in AuthService.test.ts to use SharedPgClientLive instead of PgContainer.ClientLive
5. Remove Layer.fresh() wrapper from createTestLayer() return - it's unnecessary
8. Update packages/api/test/PgTestUtils.ts to use SharedPgClientLive or share with persistence
technical_details.why_layer_fresh_is_wrong: The createTestLayer() function builds a NEW layer object on each call. Since memoization is identity-based, different calls never share. Layer.fresh() only escapes memoization within a single composition where the same reference appears multiple times - not across different factory calls.
